resources.string: Displays a toast message \u0022Turbo Charger Connected\u0022 on supported devices* when a supported charger is connected and is recognized as a \u0022Turbo\u0022 charger*\n*If in doubt check the FAQs
Displays a toast message \u0022Charge %\u0022 with the current battery percentage when the charger is unplugged
In case you don\'t see the \u0022Turbo toast\u0022, Click here to see a Toast with your current Charging type.\nIf it is not \u0022Turbo\u0022 there will be no toast upon connection
Any Qualcomm QuickCharge 2.0* charger re-branded by Motorola as a \u0022Turbo Charger\u0022\n* Qualcomm QuickCharge 3.0 and up chargers are probably supported
Rooted devices that have Turbo charger or Qualcomm QuickCharge 2.0 support
I plugged in the charger, but there is no toast?

If you are using a supported device/charger and there is no toast check:
USB cables can make a difference, use original (or high quality USB cables)
Charger may be damage try a different one
Use the "Do a Toast Test" Check the output, if that is not displaying "Turbo" at the end when you click, there will be no automatic "Turbo" toast when the charger is connected
What are the possible outputs of the \u0022Test Toast\u0022?

The kernel is configured to display the below flags when a charger is connected:
"None" no charger connected
"null" The app needs ROOT access, if you give it ROOT access it's probable that yours device doesn't have support, but if you are sure it does, please post on the XDA Support forum
"Normal" Normal charger or PC charging
"Weak" damaged charger and or cable
"Turbo" Qualcomm QuickCharge 2.0 charger or Motorola "Turbo" Charger
 If clicking on "Do a Toast Test" gets different output, take a screenshot and post on the XDA support forum

Plug in the charger to see a Toast message, if the charger is recognized by the system as a \u0022Turbo\u0022 charger, it\'s necessary to have the options \u0022Turbo Charger Toast\u0022 and \u0022Root permission\u0022 enabled, \u0022Charger Disconnect Toast\u0022 option is an extra option that shows current battery percentage after the charger is disconnected. This does not need to be enabled if you only want to see a \u0022Turbo Charger Toast\u0022
This app doesn\'t improve, in any way, how your device charges it\'s battery
Enable to give the app Root permission. Some devices may need Root permission to read kernel status for charger type
Root disable, the app may not be able to Toast correct without Root access

TurboToast!!!
Root enable in the app, but the app has no Root access

Please check Root or Disable Root permission check.
This is an open source app. Check it out on my github\ngithub.com/bhb27/turbotoast
There is no email client installed on the device.
There is no web browser installed on the device.
